pardonnez-moi , Monsieur le Président .
Monsieur le Commissaire , je vous pardonne , parce que je suis tout à fait d' accord avec vous .
Il s' agit d' un sujet très important .
In the current context of the current economic , financial and social crisis , it is essential for the European Union budget 2010 to focus particular attention on this situation and to present itself as an effective tool for overcoming the crisis .
I therefore voted in favour of the draft EU budget for 2010 , as I believe that it will meet these needs a great deal .
Parliament is determined to do all it can to guarantee appropriate funding for all activities and policies that promote growth and job creation , and provide solutions to European citizens .
More specifically , this means greater energy security , increased support for research and innovation , especially in the area of clean technologies , the promotion of small and medium-sized enterprises and increased support for lifelong learning .
In this regard , as the Portuguese Social Democrats propose , I would like to emphasise the importance of creating an Erasmus programme for employment , aimed at young people seeking first job , in order to help to achieve these objectives .
Lastly , I must emphasise that I do not agree with the Council 's additional reductions in support of the Lisbon Strategy , because these cuts run counter to what is needed to be done in order to foster growth and economic recovery .
Whilst cohesion policy plays a key role in combating the economic crisis and climate change , the Council had proposed reducing payment appropriations substantially by 2010 .
Being aware of the importance of the European funds and waiting times that exist on the ground , it was indispensable for European parliamentarians to restore , or even even even in some cases increase the amounts suggested prior to the European Commission .
This vote is the expression of the political Europe that we need , the one that is able to make budgetary choices which effectively ensure solidarity , competitiveness and growth , and this service for the citizens .
Today , MEPs have confirmed their support for a European cohesion policy that really has the means of its ambitions .
Another general orientation of the reports by MM. Surj ⁇ n and Ma ⁇ ka on the draft European Union budget for the financial year 2010 is therefore with determination that I approved their adoption .
I support the Surj ⁇ n report , which represents a possible compromise with regard to the EU budget .
I am sorry that the Council has reduced even further before the Commission 's preliminary draft budget , which , in my opinion , is already less than that necessary .
We cannot strengthen Europe with a budget that is clearly insufficient .
I disagree , in particular , with the reductions made in support of the Lisbon Strategy .
The gap between public commitments to be tackled as a priority , and supporting the ' competitiveness for growth and employment ' , and the appropriations allocated for this purpose in this draft budget , could no longer be bited .
I welcome the increased appropriations in the area of freedom , security and justice , and I would like to emphasise that the construction of a citizen 's Europe is also dependent on the proper implementation of these budget headings .
I did not vote in favour of the creation of a fund of EUR 300 million and immediate support for milk producers , as I believe that dairy producers are facing the collapse of prices , source of insecurity .
Indeed , the position adopted by the Group of the Progressive Alliance of Socialists and Democrats in the European Parliament ( S  ⁇  D ) for a fund of EUR 600 million would have offered a faster and more effective means of combating the causes and , above all , the effects that led to a significant fall in the dairy market , which has led to a significant fall in the current economic crisis .
I also believe that the series of measures adopted by the European Commission came too late .
Indeed , the fund of EUR 600 million would have provided real support for Member States in the face of this crisis .
The group of amendments to the EU budget for 2010 which makes up the ' Block 3 ' for interventions and support measures that we oppose in principle ( as we criticise in principle - and vote against - support from the EU for tobacco growing ) .
These include various storage measures , for example , for alcohol , and extensive EU support for the wine sector .
It is also support from the EU for milk and fruit in schools , which itself is important , but we believe that this issue should rather be resolved at national level .
At the same time , the group of amendments said ' Block 3 ' contains significant investments in animal welfare and the control of animal transport , for example , which we would , as a matter of principle , welcome , since we strongly support these issues in other contexts , but since the voting procedure forces us to consider the group of amendments as a whole , we have chosen to abstain from voting on Block 3 .
I voted in favour of creating this microfinance facility , given that it aims to offer opportunities for unemployed people and encourage entrepreneurship .
This instrument , which is intended for people who wish to create or develop micro-business ( less than 10 employees and a turnover not exceeding EUR 2 million ) , will open up new horizons for many people without employment .
Given the current state of the economy , it would have been helpful to have launched this important programme earlier , as it has been a long time now that people have difficulties in accessing credit .
Given that this instrument is for public and private bodies offering micro-credits to private , and micro-enterprises at national , regional and local level in EU Member States , it must be carefully monitored by the competent bodies in order to ensure that the credit really reaches the places where it is most necessary and that we did not see happening again in the last financial crisis .
par écrit . - ( EN ) Je suis favorable à l' instauration d' un microfinancement public pour les aider à créer de petites entreprises .
Je suis cependant opposé à ce que l' Union européenne effectue cette fonction .
J' ai néanmoins voté en faveur de certains amendements , car il est toujours probable que la résolution serait adoptée et je voulais améliorer la résolution le plus possible .

par écrit . - ( EN ) L' une des conséquences les plus néfastes de la crise économique mondiale est l' absence de crédits fournis par les banques , qui empêche les individus ainsi que les grandes entreprises de mener leurs activités économiques .
La proposition faite par la Commission européenne prévoit la création d' un instrument de microfinancement cherchant à aider à atténuer les hésitations actuelles en matière de financement des banques et d' autres institutions financières .
C' est pour cette raison que j' ai décidé de soutenir le rapporteur sur cette question et de voter en faveur du rapport .
I voted against the report because unemployment , which is constantly increasing in the European Union , cannot be combated with a microfinance facilities programme .
Pros integrated programmes with adequate funding and specific budget lines are needed , programmes aimed at combating youth unemployment , which is especially high in Greece , where a young young in four years ' age are unemployed .
Generally , what we need is policies which call for an increase in the Union budget and to overturn the neoliberal framework of the Stability Pact and reduce deficits .
I also believe that funding under this instrument must be purely voluntary and must not , in any case , be used by anyone who is being able to use this instrument under the threat of their social security benefits being lifted or reduced .
Unfortunately , the amendments to this effect tabled by myself and by my fellow Members from the Confederal Group of the European United Left - Nordic Green Left were rejected .
At a time when Europe is experiencing a profound economic and financial crisis , which has given rise to serious social problems with unemployment in all Member States , it is essential for the European Union to create effective mechanisms to tackle the crisis and support those who are worst affected , including the unemployed and companies in difficulty .
I therefore welcome the creation of a microfinance facility for employment , focusing on entrepreneurship and giving everyone the chance to start up their own enterprise .
micro-financing will be available in cases where access to banking credit is refused or complicated , supported by supporting the growth of micro-enterprises , as well as by sponsors , subsidies and good interest rates granted by the European Social Fund .
It is also important to point out that this instrument must serve the only objective of supporting entrepreneurship as a means of creating new jobs , helping to achieve sound business ideas , and it must not be used to provide social support or stimulating consumption .
L' ordre du jour appelle le débat sur les déclarations du Conseil et de la Commission sur les résultats du sommet de Copenhague sur le changement climatique .
Mr President , ladies and gentlemen , I am in the House today to share with you my impressions on the outcome of the Copenhagen Summit and the resulting challenges , both for the European Union and for the rotating presidency and for Spain in the first half of 2010 .
The European Union 's Environment Ministers have debated these issues at length last weekend .
I must emphasise that we broadly agree with our desire to pursue progress , on three issues in particular : to build on the outcome of the summit in order to make them as soon as possible , to strengthen their elements in the context of the UN and finally to ensure that we respect our total emissions reduction targets .
We have objectives and common strategies .
Consequently , our most pressing tasks will be to complete the process of official announcement of our commitment , to consolidate a framework of action comparable to that of other industrialised and emerging nations and , lastly , to use all the tools at our disposal , both within the European Union and in our relations with third countries .
The summit in December - a very complex conference characterised by difficult procedural discussions - concluded by the so-called agreement in Copenhagen .
Very many Heads of State or Government have been personally involved in drawing up the document adopted , which represents the willingness of countries whose total emissions total than 80 % of the emissions produced on a global scale .
One of the participants has been denied all industrialised countries , the main emerging economies and a number of particularly vulnerable countries .
This document should also help us to remove the many doubts that continue to emigrate the official process before us leading us legally binding solutions , within the framework of the UN and preference of Mexico .
With regard to the content of the agreement , I believe it is important to emphasise that we are playing clear support so as not to allow a rise in the temperature of more than two degrees .
This is certainly one of the most important points of the results and the one that has the greatest potential : the commitment of all industrialised countries to establish a reduction objective that can be achieved by all their economies .
The emerging nations , on the matter , will take concrete and verifiable measures that will allow them to substantially reduce their emissions growth : funding based on solidarity and support immediate and medium-term measures to combat climate change ; elements intended to bring about new governance models ; and mechanisms for technological development and reducing emissions from deforestation .
The Copenhagen Summit has shown us in a new international context , a context that requires improvements if we are to offer solutions to global problems .
The rules of the decision-making process must be changed in such a way as to properly adapt to such a new type of situation and needs .
We have the necessary tools for acting : a legislative instrument that is already in place at Community level ; the commitment to continue the reduction in emissions ; international solidarity and innovation and technological cooperation ; and adequate institutional structure within the Union that we need to use with intelligence , taking full advantage of its complementarity .
During the negotiations and planning of the policies on climate change , we will have to involve the Environment Council 's authority ' with greater external action capacity .
Furthermore , we should make the link between the environmental mission that lies ahead with us and the opinions of our experts on economic and innovation policies ; we should also improve coherence between our climate objectives and our model of development and prosperity .
All this must be done without losing sight - both within the European Union and outside - of consolidating the role of public opinion and legislators who are committed to investing in a better future and protecting the general interest .
Now that we have a common European experience .
Firstly , we must press ourselves to get a proper response before 31 January .
In bringing together all those who must reduce their emissions , the agreement in Copenhagen allows for a comparison to be made , in comparison with the objectives made by the European Union , but we are not , however , very proud of the commitment of the other countries .
If it is not enough , we will be obliged to continue our efforts to step up our collective reductions .
We will also have to create the conditions for the rapid application of the elements that make up the agreement .
It is essential for the European Union and its Member States to be at the forefront of the countries that keep their promises .
For this reason , we will have to carry out the transfer of funds earmarked for the 2010-2012 period as soon as possible .
We want to develop a financial framework that can support our commitments to third countries within the climate fund in Copenhagen and , at the same time , encourage improvements in the accounting rules and our response in terms of reducing emissions from deforestation and technological cooperation .
The following elements need to be added : our own policies aimed at achieving our objectives of reducing emissions both at a local and Community level ; stimulating through innovation and the intelligent use of energy ; incorporation of measures for sectoral policies and external action .
We want to work closely with the Commission and Parliament on all these areas , by seeking us to define as a pioneering region in the fight against climate change , with the highest carbon emissions , the better prepared to face the challenges posed by climate change and the more effective way of taking these elements a powerful force for innovation and competitiveness .
Our climate change policy is one of the fundamental characteristics of the European model .
We were the first to incorporate this principle into our proposals for more sustainable and equitable development , not only economically , but also socially and environmentally friendly , while also bearing in mind that we are strengthening at the same time international security .
This has enabled key actors , such as China and the United States , to assert itself with the same negotiating table and to define and share elements of decisive cooperation .
The European Union , which is a strong champion of the role of the United Nations in resolving global problems , will also have a role to play in other , both bilateral and multilateral areas , as well as informal , helping everyone to properly define the opportunities , listening to our partners and labouches to promote sectoral responses in line with our needs in the fight against climate change .
We must make full use of the adoption of the Treaty of Lisbon and the entry into force of the new institutions , in order to systematically integrate the essential messages in the fight against climate change in our relations with third countries .
It is not a sincerity that is waiting for us .
The Spanish Government is well aware of the extent of the challenge and now showing that it is committed to making as much progress as possible on the elements that can foster the signing of an ambitious and binding agreement in Mexico .
We cannot leave the political opportunity created in Copenhagen , nor can we reduce our expectations or the expectations of the international community .
It is our credibility that is at stake .
We must keep good .
The new increased powers of the European Parliament , which brings citizens closer and fruitful cooperation .
I wish to conclude my speech by praising everyone on this point , and I would remind you that , more than ever , we need your work and support for the crucial period for the six months to come .
membre de la Commission . - ( EN ) Monsieur le Président , permettez-moi de vous remercier , au nom de la Commission , de m' avoir permis de discuter des résultats de la conférence de Copenhague sur le changement climatique et du suivi de l' accord de Copenhague .
Mon collègue , Stavros Dimas , m' a demandé de présenter ses excuses au nom de ne pas pouvoir être présent lui-même parce qu' il est malade , ce qui est particulièrement regrettable , car il aurait probablement été sa dernière naissance plénière .
Je m' autorise à remplacer Stavros dans ce débat très important .
Je souhaite exprimer notre appréciation sur le rôle actif et de soutien que le Parlement a joué avant la conférence et lors de la conférence elle-même .
Les contacts avec votre délégation au cours de cette conférence se sont avérés les plus utiles .
En particulier , vous avez joué un rôle crucial afin d' accroître notre proximité avec des acteurs clés dans d' autres pays et d' autres régions .
Je pense que nous partageons le point de vue selon lequel le résultat de Copenhague n' est que notre objectif d' un accord contraignant ambitieux et juridiquement contraignant , qui serait nécessaire de limiter le changement climatique à un niveau inférieur à 2  ⁇  C. C. c' est extrêmement décevant pour tous ceux d' entre nous qui se sont battus pendant des années et des années pour que des décisions concrètes en matière de lutte contre le changement climatique .
Les raisons de l' échec étaient nombreuses et je les reviendrai en un moment .
Pourtant , on peut également conclure que l' accord est mieux qu' aucune issue , ce qui aurait été le pire scénario .
D' une part - pour trouver quelque chose de positif - l' accord de Copenhague reconnaît au moins la nécessité de limiter le changement climatique à un niveau inférieur à 2  ⁇  C. Il invite également les pays développés à fixer des objectifs d' émission à l' échelle de l' économie le 31 janvier 2010 et à exiger que les pays en développement présentent une liste d' actions pour la même date .
En outre , l' accord fixe la base d' un paquet financier assez important de 30 milliards de dollars pour les trois années à venir et reconnaît la nécessité d' accorder 100 milliards de dollars par an à 2020 .
Par ailleurs , l' accord présente de graves faiblesses .
Elle ne fait aucune référence aux objectifs à mi-parcours ou à des objectifs d' atténuation à long terme .
La réduction annoncée jusqu' à présent ne suffit pas à rester dans le cadre de l' objectif de 2  ⁇  C. Il y a malheureusement , selon moi , peu de raisons d' optimisme que nous connaîtrions de meilleures offres d' ici le 31 janvier - plutôt que l' inverse .
Enfin , et ce n' est certainement pas le moins important , l' accord n' est pas juridiquement contraignant et peut-être même plus inquiétant , il ne fournit pas la conclusion d' un accord juridiquement contraignant cette année , qui était l' un de nos objectifs clés .
En prévision de l' avenir , la prochaine étape devra être de s' assurer que cet accord deviendra au moins opérationnel et ouvrira la voie à un nouveau traité sur le climat , qui doit être conclu d' urgence au cours de cette année .
En premier lieu , il sera essentiel de faire en sorte que toutes les parties clés soutiennent désormais l' accord et informent leurs objectifs ou actions d' ici le 31 janvier .
Des financements adéquats doivent également être fournis .
⁇  cet égard , nous devons explorer les moyens de mettre sur pied un Fonds du climat vert de Copenhague .
Nous devons également renforcer les alliances avec les pays et régions qui partagent notre vision d' un résultat fructueux dans les négociations sur le climat international .
En conclusion , nous avons d' énormes défis devant nous pour garantir l' unité au niveau européen , pour nous engager sur le plan stratégique avec les partenaires extérieurs clés et pour maintenir notre plein engagement en faveur de l' action climatique multilatérale , mais il y a beaucoup de leçons à retenir la COP 15 .
Une leçon frappant est certainement que nous devons apprendre à parler d' une seule voix .
⁇  Copenhague , en Chine , en Inde , aux États-Unis et à d' autres grandes puissances , chacun a parlé d' une seule voix , alors que l' Europe a parlé avec de nombreuses voix différentes .
Il en va de même pour la gouvernance économique mondiale et la sécurité internationale .
Nous sommes en effet à un carrefour aujourd' hui .
Soit nous prenons des mesures déterminées et unies pour la relance écologique , économique et politique de l' Europe , soit nous risquons de stagnation économique et de incohérence politique .
Prenons Copenhague comme un avertissement alarmant de ce scénario .
Nous devons mieux faire que cela et nous pouvons le faire .
Seul nous sommes unis , nous pouvons réussir , et je suis impatient de travailler avec vous pour atteindre cet objectif .

rapporteur . - ( EN ) Madame la Présidente , j' apprécie totalement votre présence en plénière ce soir .
Je voudrais remercier tous les rapporteurs fictifs pour nos discussions fructueuses et notre travail sur ce rapport .
L' entrée en vigueur du traité de Lisbonne confère à l' Union européenne davantage de compétences dans le domaine de la politique énergétique .
Je pense qu' il s' agit d' un domaine dans lequel , si les États membres travaillent ensemble , l' Europe peut garantir une énergie sûre , moins coûteuse et plus efficace pour ses citoyens .
Ensemble , nous pouvons minimiser l' impact d' événements imprévisibles , comme les perturbations du gaz que connaît l' Europe l' hiver dernier .
Bien sûr , l' Europe ne peut pas s' immiscer dans le flux gazier en dehors de ses frontières ou résoudre de tels conflits , mais nous pouvons faire en sorte que nos infrastructures puissent faire face à des pénuries d' approvisionnement ou à des échecs , et rendre le marché plus transparent et plus efficace .
L' Europe a défini cette priorité très importante dans son ordre du jour .
L' année dernière , nous avons adopté un troisième paquet énergie visant à garantir un marché de l' énergie plus compétitif et plus efficace .
Un règlement sur la sécurité de l' approvisionnement en gaz est actuellement sur la table au Parlement et le vote de demain sur le règlement relatif à la notification des investissements dans les infrastructures énergétiques contribuera à rendre le marché plus transparent et plus prévisible .
Dans ce contexte , je pense qu' il serait regrettable de gaspiller l' opportunité que offre ce nouvel instrument , en n' appliquant pas la base juridique correcte fournie par le nouvel article 194 du traité de Lisbonne .
C' est un point très important d' ordre institutionnel , politique et juridique .
Ce règlement n' est pas seulement un outil de collecte d' informations ; il peut également donner une vue globale sur les investissements dans les infrastructures énergétiques comme base pour avoir des politiques .
Dès lors , si le Conseil adopte ce règlement sur la mauvaise base juridique , je considère que le Parlement devrait poursuivre cette affaire devant la Cour de justice européenne , et permettez-moi de vous assurer qu' il le fera .
Sur le fond , je l' ai dit avant , à M. Barroso , et je le dirai encore à vous , Monsieur le Commissaire Oettinger : l' Europe est à un tournant et notre priorité à présent doit être plus que jamais de soutenir nos entreprises et de créer un environnement positif pour la compétitivité .
Nous avons donc besoin de politiques fortes et , en particulier , d' une politique énergétique plus fiable .
En fin de compte , l' objectif est de garantir une énergie sûre et bon marché pour nos citoyens et nos entreprises .
⁇  cet égard , j' espère que la collecte des données ne deviendra pas un but en soi .
Nous devons veiller à ce que ce règlement ne créera pas une charge bureaucratique supplémentaire pour les entreprises et à ce que la confidentialité des informations commerciales sensibles soit renforcée .
Une autre question , je ne peux que regretter que les groupes PPE et S  ⁇  D aient introduit un amendement exigeant que les entreprises de l' UE fournissent des données sur les investissements dans des projets dans des pays tiers .
Je mets au défi de trouver la base juridique dans les Traités qui permettrait une extraterritorialité dans la politique énergétique .
En outre , je pense que nous devrions d' abord commencer à prouver que nous savons ce qu' il est prévu au niveau européen avant de considérer l' extérieur de nos frontières .
J' ai également remarqué la tentation , dans cette Assemblée , d' inclure tout à ce règlement .
Je pense que c' est une erreur .
Pour que cet instrument soit efficace , nous devons nous concentrer sur des informations réellement cohérentes et garder à l' esprit trop souvent la bureaucratie et les questions de confidentialité pour nos entreprises et la Commission .
J' ai essayé d' atteindre cet équilibre d' une part , afin de donner à la Commission l' opportunité d' avoir un aperçu des développements futurs possibles , mais aussi , d' autre part , de veiller à ce que ce tableau soit aussi exact que possible .
Nous avons également besoin d' une certaine certitude quant aux investissements futurs pour garantir une politique solide et appropriée .
Je serais également convaincue , Monsieur le Commissaire Oettinger .
Je veux éviter une situation dans laquelle la Commission , qui a réunis les données , commence par imposer des plans d' investissement et finit par dire aux entreprises qu' elles n' investissent pas ici mais là-bas .
Toutefois , elle doit fournir des solutions et des incitants aux entreprises afin de rendre des investissements non rentables à court terme qui pourraient être nécessaires pour garantir la sécurité de l' approvisionnement , sans quoi les lacunes resteront .
Je suis ici en train d' arrêter .
Merci pour votre temps et je me réjouis d' entendre vos commentaires .
Madam President , Mrs V ⁇ lean , ladies and gentlemen , the gas crisis at the beginning of last year showed us how important it is for Europe to have energy infrastructure in place which not only promote the proper functioning of the internal market , but also allow solidarity between the Member States and the regions affected in the event of crisis .
It is therefore important that the Commission has an overview of the new investment projects provided for or under construction , and life facilities must be brought to the end .
Therefore , our proposal is to develop and rehashing an instrument for information from another crisis , namely the first oil crisis .
This proposal is intended to extend the scope of the regulation , especially in the areas of renewable energy and new technology .
We welcome Parliament 's proposals to include areas of application such as heating and gas , coal or oil production capacities .
We also want to take into account existing communication obligations , provided that the information available within the framework of the analyses that the Commission must be exploitable .

Madam President , ladies and gentlemen , I was referring to the way in which the Commission wishes to assess the information it receives from the Member States in the context of this regulation .
Our analyses will examine , first and foremost , the planned development of infrastructure in terms of changes in demand .
We will study whether the expected new capacities will respond to the future expected request , or whether we can expect us to be able to look at the problems .
In this connection , unlike the current regulation , it would appear important to introduce institutional negotiations on these matters .
The Commission is therefore proposing , firstly , that a report be published every two years on the structural developments in energy infrastructure .
The aim is to help improve transparency for all market agents .
Secondly , we also want a political debate with Parliament and the Member States to be able to draw conclusions .
I would like to emphasise this last point because one thing is clear : the regulation itself is an instrument that is used to collate and gather information with a view to demonstrating whether any kind of action is needed .
The way to proceed with specific initiatives in the field of energy policies must be addressed .
This leads me , Madam V ⁇ lean , which is of interest to you , and to the House as a whole , namely the new Article 194 of the Treaty of Lisbon and its application .
For all of us - Parliament , the Council and the Commission - this article represents an opportunity to shape the EU 's energy policy in close cooperation - in other words , with the European Parliament in particular .
As a new Commissioner for Energy , I would therefore like to make an active role in this House in all future political measures as far as possible and as quickly as possible .
However , the legal act on which today 's debate refers is concerned only with the collection and assessment of information in the energy sector and is therefore based , according to the Commission 's interpretation , on Articles 337 and 187 of the Euratom Treaty .
The content of the regulation complies with the two articles of primary law and , according to the case-law , the choice of the legal basis for the secondary law must be linked to measurable criteria for content .
No energy policy is decided by simple collection and assessment of information , which is why , in my opinion , a decision is needed here .
I request your indulgence in this regard .
Given the importance of an integrated energy policy , not only to combat climate change and reduce CO2 emissions , but also to ensure the effectiveness and minimisation of energy dependency in Europe , communication and transmission of information on investment and energy infrastructure projects are of the utmost importance .
For the sake of European energy policy , it is vital for the Commission to be aware of the latest energy investment projects within the Member States in order to be able to develop integrated policies which promote energy efficiency and investment in cleaner technologies , thus ensuring that our energy independence gradually has a bearing on energy suppliers and on fossil fuels .
I therefore support the proposal for a regulation , and particularly with regard to its necessary implementation , as the regulation that it aims to replace has , it has never been implemented .
This proposal for a regulation contributes to the establishment of a European energy policy that aims to promote the effectiveness , reliability and security of our energy .
Energy efficiency is one of the European Union 's priority policies , given the importance of preserving and abiding resources , and of meeting the Union 's commitments in the fight against climate change .
I would remind you that before moving to new projects , the EU 's objective of achieving the 20 % energy efficiency target must be taken into account .
This means that investment projects in energy infrastructures must be compatible with the objective of achieving a minimum of 20 % energy from sustainable and renewable sources by 2020 .
Energy policy must guarantee low carbon emissions and be based on solidarity and sustainability .
The reliability of the system is important because it must be able to work without interruption .
It must take into account the worsening in the energy sector , which is understood both within the EU and in the rest of the world .
Attention should also be given to the essential investment in infrastructure to avoid problems relating to energy supply security .
The rapporteur considers it to be a very important piece of the puzzle of EU energy policy , starting with the principle that we cannot effectively promote an energy policy at European level without providing adequate information about our energy infrastructures .
⁇ et , beyond our fundamental disagreement over European energy policy , this report can also be reproduced in a legal context or even within the framework of the internal market .
There are , however , also positive aspects in this report , particularly when it states that confidentiality of information must be guaranteed and that any proposals that result from them are neutral and must not be seen as political interventions on the market .
Furthermore , the reporting obligations must be easy to fulfil , so as to avoid unnecessarily imposing additional burdens on companies , the administration of the Member States or the Commission .
That is why we have finally chosen to abstain .
I voted in favour of the Valean report on the proposal for a Council regulation on the communication to the Commission on investment projects for energy infrastructure in the European Community .
It is , in fact , essential to have a panic with sufficient regard to promoting better suitability between supply and demand for energy at European level and to decide the most sensible infrastructure investment investment .
This will also increase transparency in the market ( while protecting companies ' data ) and combating energy phenomena with regard to a source or supply site .
par écrit . - ( EN ) Malgré la déception de Copenhague , l' UE ne peut pas autoriser le manque de consensus international pour ralentir nos propres efforts dans l' exécution d' une politique énergétique durable .

The French delegation has reiterated its wish to have a study of impact and specific proposals by the European Commission on the creation of tax on financial transactions by supporting the resolution adopted on Wednesday by a very large majority ( 536 for , 80 against and 33 abstentions ) .
We call on the Commission to draw up a proposal so as to establish a common European position to present the G20 in June .
It would also be appropriate to evaluate to what extent such a tax could contribute to stabilising the financial markets .
The questions to which the Commission should provide answers relate to the use of this tax in order to support the adaptation of developing countries to climate change and the funding of development cooperation , but also how levers the Commission could use to persuade its partners to put the tax in place so as to avoid migration .
Above all , however , it is an in-depth impact study to ensure that this tax will not reduce the competitiveness of the Union or sustainable investment , innovation and growth or will have a negative impact on small and medium-sized enterprises and individual investors .
In the year 2000 , I tabled the ' globalisation ' group ' the first resolution calling on the Commission to investigate the feasibility of a tax on speculative capital movements .
It was not voted on , with a few votes .
Over the past 10 years , the G20 , like several Member States , no longer deviate from the assumption of such a tax , and especially the financial crisis , has come to remember the damage caused by the volatility of the financial markets .
I therefore welcome the broad adoption of the resolution on tax on financial transactions .
This is only a small step , but the message is clear .
Parliament is asking the Commission to at last take up the subject and work with a project of implementation .
Such a tax would have a dual advantage in helping to stabilise markets and generate huge income to help developing countries fund their adaptation to climate change and the fight against poverty .
We are opposed to the fact that it would only be effective if it is global : but it must be completed , as a few countries are being done in the tax on air tickets .
The wait-and-seetism will not have any effect .
This must be opened up .
The financial sector must shoulder its responsibilities in the economic crisis that continues to cause us to be saddled .
So far , the players in the real economy - taxpayers , consumers , public services and society in general - have borne a great deal of the costs and consequences of the financial crisis .
Several Member States have requested a financial transaction tax .
Today , the political and regulatory climate in this area has changed .
New regulatory initiatives have been launched , such as the fight against tax havens , the removal of legal loopholes for companies ' accounts , the requirements for stock market transactions and the central use of reference points for the registration of derivatives .
The European Union must adopt a common position in the international context of G20 meetings .
In order to do this , it must assess the impact of a global tax on financial transactions before the next G20 summit .
This assessment must particularly examine the effects of the introduction of a tax on financial transactions in the European Union by comparison of its introduction on a global level .
The costs will have to be weighed up and determine whether this tax would help to stabilise the financial markets .
The various declarations of the preamble to the resolution approved today by a majority in Parliament are positive .
This is particularly the case with the statement that the financial sector must take a fair role in relaunching and developing the economy , the costs and the substantial effects of the crisis have hitherto been borne by the real economy , taxpayers , traders , public services and society in general .
In addition to these declarations , however , this resolution almost regrets the idea of any measure that could lead to a tax on financial transactions and its application to a great deal of constraints .
That is why we have abstained .
Unfortunately , there has been a delay in the application of new regulatory initiatives and in the progress of the fight against tax havens , the elimination of shortcomings in off-the-counter commitments , the demands for stock market transactions and the use of central reference points for the registration of derivatives .
It is necessary to make decisive progress and not to continue sailing in these waters waters , which serve only the interests of financial speculators and big capital .

The year 2008 , which marked the beginning of the most recent economic crisis that the world has experienced for several decades , determined the way in which the global economy and the European economy were going to develop in the future , and this for a long time .

The growing budget deficits in the Member States , combined with a growing debt , are the main macro-economic consequences of the crisis .

Has the ECB fulfilled its role ?
It is difficult to be safe .

However , I think that this instability can be explained by the surprise that the crisis has created .
From October 2008 , the ECB 's monetary policy can be described as active and flexible .
In view of the crisis , the ECB has adopted a different strategy from that of other large central banks in the world .
We are still waiting for the results of these actions .

par écrit . - ( PT ) La lutte contre le terrorisme doit être une priorité pour l' Union européenne .
La coopération proactive avec les États-Unis dans ce contexte , à savoir en termes d' information et de partage des données , est primordiale pour améliorer l' efficacité de la lutte contre le terrorisme , pour prévenir les futures attaques et garantir la sécurité du public européen .
Je vote donc en faveur des mesures proposées dans ce rapport .
Les amendements déposés à cet accord reflètent non seulement la majorité des préoccupations exprimées par le Parlement européen à l' époque du rejet du 11 février , mais expriment aussi la nécessité de la proportionnalité dans le traitement de ces données , à savoir en ce qui concerne leur transformation , leur stockage et leur suppression ultérieure .
J' insiste également sur les garanties renforcées du nouvel accord donne aux citoyens européens en termes de protection des données , à savoir le droit de faire appel contre les décisions judiciaires et administratives , le droit à la transparence et à la communication des informations aux citoyens en question et la définition du domaine de l' application des données , limité à l' activité directement liée au terrorisme ou à son financement .
Six months ago , the European Parliament was presenting itself with an advocate of fundamental rights , by rejecting the agreement between the EU and the US on the transfer and processing of banking data - said ' SWIFT agreement ' .
Thanks to the work of parliamentarians and , in particular , our group , a new version has been drafted .
It contains significant improvements in terms of content , such as the removal of data transfers from bulks .
The rights of individuals will therefore be better protected , while recognising the importance of monitoring financial data in the fight against terrorism .
I have therefore chosen to vote in favour of the new agreement .
However , I will continue to look particularly closely at the following points : the prerogatives of the European data protection authorities and the choice of Europol as a filtering authority ; the effectiveness of the ' right to repair ' of persons whose rights have been trampled underfoot ; monitoring and evaluation of the data provided to the US authorities .
I voted in favour of the conclusion of the new agreement between the EU and the United States on the processing and transfer of financial data for the exchange programme for the monitoring of terrorism , as I feel that the new Commission proposal would have enhanced guarantees to European citizens , particularly in terms of data protection .
I believe , in fact , that any transfer of European personal data to a third country for security purposes must also respect the procedural guarantees and rights of defence that compliance with national and European data protection rights .
A few months ago , the first draft of the agreement was too vague and did not provide such guarantees .
That is why we said no .
Today , I am pleased that our proposals for improvement have been taken , among other things , to establish a similar trading system at European level and to ensure that monitoring is given to European officials who must be able to oppose the extraction of data on the US soil .

par écrit . - ( PT ) L' objectif de la présente décision est d' établir l' organisation et le fonctionnement du service européen pour l' action extérieure ( SEAE ) , un organe indépendant de l' Union sous l' autorité de la haute représentante , créée par l' article 27 ( 3 ) du traité sur l' Union européenne ( TUE ) , tel que modifié par le traité de Lisbonne .

As MEPs of a strengthened European Parliament by the Treaty , we can contribute to this .

Mr Brok 's report and Mr Verhofstadt is an important document which values the entire work and deserves support .
What has Parliament managed to gain in negotiations with the High Representative ?
Firstly , a diplomatic service of the European Union , not an intergovernmental service , and this means an assurance that 60 % of the posts will be designated by the European Union .
Secondly , the political and budgetary supervision of the EEAS by Parliament , which means the capacity to make it possible for candidates to be kept up with delegation positions and inspected the finances of the institution , as we do in the Commission and the Council .
Thirdly , equal division of jobs in terms of nationality and sex , and also an examination of the composition of the service in 2013 in order to correct all imbalances .

Déclarations écrites ( article 149 )
The financial crisis has contributed to a severe deterioration in the social situation of the European population .
The recovery has renewed time , the unemployment rate is high and weak economic growth .
The EU 2020 strategy ( EU 2020 ) aims to set up a programme to facilitate the creation of economic growth that can provide more jobs and increased competitiveness within the Union .
Its emblematic initiatives are a path for us to follow in order to make Europe more inclusive .
The Treaty of Lisbon strengthens the dimension of European social policy .
Europe belongs to the population and part of its mission is helping to promote employment and improve living and working conditions .
I would like to emphasise the crucial nature of dialogue between the social partners and the role of small and medium-sized enterprises as the motor of the economy .
We must achieve the objectives of the Treaty of Lisbon with regard to social issues , through the specific proposals included in the Europe 2020 strategy , for example , emblematic initiatives such as ' industrial policy in the age of globalisation ' or ' a strategy for new skills and jobs ' .
Europe needs to be more competitive and capable of meeting the challenges of globalisation without , however , voting to be inclusive and aim for sustainable development which guarantees social integration .
The Treaty of Lisbon reiterates the commitment of the Member States to respect the basic social rights enshrined in the European Social Charter ( in 1961 ) and in the Community Charter of Fundamental Social Rights of the workers ( in 1989 ) .
It reaffirms that the European Union is working towards Europe 's sustainable development .
The European economy is a social market economy , promoting a high level of competitiveness .
Its objectives include full employment , social progress and high levels of protection and improving the quality of the environment .
The EU is combating social exclusion and promoting justice and social protection , gender equality , intergenerational solidarity and the protection of children 's rights .
In August , the unemployment rate in the EU 27 was 9.6 % , with unemployment among young people at 20 % .
The economic and financial crisis has had a dramatic impact on the social environment , with the main concern being that European citizens are currently finding employment and ensuring good quality of life .
The European Union , mainly its 500 million citizens , and that is why Europe must have a social aspect .
Social Europe must offer Europe 's citizens jobs and a decent life , decent education and opportunities for integration into the labour market for young people , as well as a decent life and quality healthcare services for pensioners .

The absence of rules and supervision does not lead to nowhere .

My vote is , therefore , undeniably in favour of this report .
The current financial and economic crisis has shown that the EU is increasingly in need of robust economic and monetary governance in order not to jeopardise the stability of the euro and monetary union .
Therefore , the Europe 2020 strategy should seek to promote economic growth and create jobs because the fall in GDP , the brutal fall in industrial production and the high number of unemployed people are a major economic and social challenge that only strong governance , harmonious and united governance can overcome .
Mr Feio 's report identifies resources and sets out strategies aimed at actually strengthening economic governance and the EU 's stability framework , with primarily placing the emphasis on the euro area .
For example , let me mention , among other things , the establishment of a coherent and transparent framework for surveillance , the strengthening of the rules of the Stability and Growth Pact and the improvement of economic governance in the euro area .

I voted in favour of Parliament 's position because I think that :
the current directive does not regulate alternative investment funds , which can always be regulated and monitored at national level ;
It is necessary to ensure that the actions of alternative investment fund managers are subject to close supervision in terms of governance ;
players should be forced to apply and maintain compatible policies and practices with healthy and effective risk management for categories of staff whose professional activities have a significant impact on the risk profile of alternative investment funds they manage ;
obligations for information and range , and safeguards against asset stripping should be subject to general exemption from the control of small and medium-sized enterprises ( SMEs ) ;
It is necessary to clarify the powers and duties of the competent authorities responsible for implementing this directive and to strengthen the mechanisms that enable effective cross-border cooperation with regard to monitoring .
In Europe , alternative investment fund managers are responsible for managing a considerable amount of assets .
They represent a significant proportion of trade in the financial instruments markets and can have an important impact on the markets and the companies in which they invest .
I am sure that the impact of alternative investment fund managers on the markets in which they are active is important , but recently financial difficulties have highlighted the fact that the activities of investment fund managers may also contribute to the development and the spread of risks in the financial system and the economy .
The aim of this directive must also be to create incentives for the transfer of offshore funds to the Union , which would provide advantages in regulating and protecting investors , while at the same time setting the appropriate level of income for managers , fund and alternative investors .
I would like to emphasise , in this sitting , that , by providing non-competitive national responses to these risks , we will have difficulty managing these risks effectively .
I am voting against this report as it only helps to regulate the behaviour of management companies with alternative investment funds , without affecting nature or composition of the financial products in question .
This commitment in favour of ' creativity ' in the financial sector lacks the intrinsic and destabilising scale of speculation , which is central to this type of fund .
The proposed rules are , moreover , also unduly weak .
These are so-called exceptions and exemptions at European level that they do not fundamentally distance the model of the various national regulations that are currently in force .
The report also fails to draw up a clear distinction between those who work with this type of fund and those with traditional banking activities , as well as blocking the actions of hedge funds placed in tax havens .
Instead of this , by setting ' thresholds ' for the value of ' assets ' , it opens the way for even-handed processes of fragmentation which will eliminate its scope of huge investment firms intended to be covered by the directive .
The security of EU public financial assets is a public good whose importance is too great to allow it to be exposed to the timidity of the proposed directive .
The financial crisis has highlighted the need to submit the activities of the various financial markets to close supervision , and particularly inorganisms involved in the management and administration of alternative investment funds .
In fact , the impact of alternative investment fund managers on the markets in which they are active is widely beneficial , but the recent financial difficulties have demonstrated that their activities have proved to be a broad range of risks , and in order to properly manage them with a coherent framework for the whole of the European Union .
It has , in fact , been shown that the establishment of a regulatory and harmonised monitoring framework at European level was adapted to the cross-border nature of the risks involved in activities of alternative investment fund managers , thereby helping to strengthen the internal market .
For all these reasons , I voted in favour of Parliament 's position .
I would like to thank Mr Gauzès for his excellent work .
The European directive on hedge funds , private equity funds and other alternative investment funds , launched by the European Commission in April 2009 in response to the financial crisis and in line with the guidelines defined at the G20 Summit , was finally approved by a very large majority .
This is yet another step in favour of the European ambition to provide itself with operational financial governance from the beginning of 2011 .
These new rules would make the international financial system more accountable and transparent and would help to reduce speculation .
According to this directive , investors from speculative funds based in countries outside the EU ( fund managers of speculative funds often live in tax havens ) will be forced to comply with the same conditions as those imposed on all European companies if they wish to act on the European market .
In order to achieve this ' European passport ' with the competent supervisory authorities of the EU , alternative fund managers will therefore have to accept clear rules , limits on speculation and increased transparency .
I voted in favour of the resolution on the EU 's external strategy on Passenger Name Record ( PNR ) data , since I believe that the conclusion of agreements that allow the exchange of information on PNR data between the European Union and Canada , the USA and Australia , is of paramount importance to international security .
I therefore welcome the Commission 's recommendation to authorise the opening of negotiations with a view to the conclusion of such agreements .
In fact , the usefulness of exchanging this data in the fight against terrorism and international crime has been established for several years .
These international data transfers of PNR data provide the repressive services of our states with valuable tools in the fight against the terrorist threat .
On the other hand , it is necessary to emphasise that the new global approach to PNR data presented by the Commission last October , with a view to setting general criteria for all PNR agreements , is , in my opinion , very positive .
It will offer these agreements a more structured and more coherent framework , and it provides considerable guarantees in terms of personal data protection .
This resolution completely contradicts the resolution which this House adopted in May last year .
It ' welcomes ' ( sic ) the Commission 's proposal of September .
This confirms the transmission of PNR data to third states and contains no satisfactory guarantees that these data will be used .
What is worse : their unlimited conservation for profiling is considered to be legitimate  ⁇
What is the fence of the Imiemades of this resolution that is at the heart of a project that it endorses ?
I am voting against this resolution , which tramples on the right of every human being to respect his personal data .
Passenger Name Record ( PNR ) is a further weapon in the fight against terrorism .
Under the Treaty of Lisbon , it is incumbent on Parliament to contribute to the drafting of a new external strategy for the negotiation of a new PNR agreement between the European Union , the United States , Australia and Canada .
The European Union is prepared to negotiate any agreement that could be useful in connection with this fight .
On the other hand , the Union will not compromise either civil liberties or fundamental rights .
I fully share the objective of preventing and combating terrorism and other serious forms of transnational crime .
In addition to countries using Passenger Name Record ' data in this context .
However , it is fundamental that , in the digital age , particular attention is given to respect and the protection of fundamental civil liberties and rights , including the right to privacy and data protection .
The key principles that must be devised in this area are necessary and proportionality .
The collection of passenger data must not only be useful , but it must be necessary .
The principle of proportionality must not , moreover , be allowed to go beyond what is needed in order to achieve the objectives intended .
In this way , there can be no question of using the data for the purposes of exploitation or profiling .
Since the entry into force of the Treaty of Lisbon , the European Parliament has played a major role in approving these agreements and must therefore be fully and regularly informed about all developments in PNR data .
In recent years , we have seen a growing restriction on fundamental rights in connection with the so-called war against terrorism .
The underlying logic of this development is , in any case , dubious .
While passengers are almost searted at the hands of their floor , and are forbidden to sell obstacles or fromodor in their luggage , the controls of goods are often left behind in care for the transport companies themselves .
If this is to change in the future , it will be important to preserve the balance between freedom and security .
In the case of passenger safety controls , this balance is already breaking out , to such times as , hysteria around the back door of terrorism , regulations will once again be more relaxed .
Similarly , we are entitled to ask ourselves if the FBI is to take on the name , the electronic number , the credit card ' number and the number of clotheders who travel to the US , and if it should be permitted to store these data for a long time .
Information should be retained only in a few exceptional cases .
If we derogation from fundamental rights in order to create a sense of security , the derogation must be as restricted as possible and people 's rights must be strengthened .
Unfortunately , this scenario has little opportunity at the moment , and I have therefore voted against the proposal .
Ladies and gentlemen , as you are already aware , Lithuania will undertake the presidency of the Organisation for Security and Cooperation in Europe ( OSCE ) in January 2011 .
This Presidency could offer a unique opportunity to take initiatives to strengthen regional cooperation , increase energy security and fight against corruption .
It is also important not to underestimate the human dimension of OSCE cooperation , nor its political and military dimension .
The OSCE also plays a key role in promoting respect for human rights and fundamental freedoms .
The EU must also play an important role in this area .
The coordination of EU and OSCE 's activities in the area of human rights is a common interest which we all share .
Let us not forget the circumstances in which the OSCE has been created .
This year marks the 35th anniversary of the inaugural conference of the OSCE and the final Act of Helsinki , which laid the foundations of this organisation .
This event was a symbol of moral and political commitment to the principles of democracy and human rights .
It is a pity that this spirit of Helsinki has come to light over the last few years .
That must change .
I therefore await with great impatience the results of the OSCE Summit in December in Astana .
I voted in favour of this report because the Organisation for Security and Cooperation in Europe ( OSCE ) has lost a lot of influence over the last 10 years .
In the motion for a resolution , the European Parliament is praising the activities past of the OSCE and calls on the Member States , the Commission and the High Representative of the Union for Foreign Affairs and Security Policy to present proposals on how the Union can actually participate more in the OSCE and can make a constructive contribution to achieving common objectives .
Anyone who wanted to avoid military intervention in a crisis must take preventive policies in due course .
The history shows us that armed conflicts are the result of efforts to tackle the contentious issues and find compromises .
The OSCE is a platform to seek this type of solution .
At the same time , the OSCE is now being respected as an independent refere for the assessment of the democratic conduct of certain elections and democratic standards .
I am therefore in favour of strengthening the OSCE , particularly with regard to promoting democracy and respect for human rights .
Election Observation and OSCE missions play an important role in expanding the free world .
However , from the EU 's point of view , there are some overlapping activities .
If we talk about strengthening the OSCE , we should also consider how far the OSCE can replace the activities of EU representatives in different regions in conflict .
Similarly , while we commend the OSCE 's work in the area of human rights , this opens the way for a discussion on the possible découpage of the roles of the OSCE and the Council of Europe .
This discussion should be aimed at greater efficiency in spending of public funds , which , at a time when cost denunciation , is undoubtedly a priority for our voters .
I voted in favour of the report on the demographic challenge and solidarity between generations because , in the current context of demographic problems without precedent arising from an increase in life expectancy and the fall in birth rates , these are one of the most urgent social policy challenges in the coming years .
Decisions need to be made urgently , especially at a time when the availability of jobs for young people and the sustainability of pension systems for older people are at risk .
intergenerational solidarity must allow two generations to optimise their contributions .
The only way to achieve this is to guarantee access to free and fair access to jobs , lifelong learning and work .
It can be achieved , firstly , by ensuring that young people are able to find a job and , secondly , by making the contribution that older citizens can still make to society , particularly in terms of voluntary work , and continuing to work beyond the compulsory retirement age .
While stressing that a society that respects human dignity is based on the principle of justice between generations , I believe that this report is important in terms of fighting any form of prejudice and discrimination against every kind of society and also segregation .
I believe that immigration , combined with successful integration , including economic integration , can be one of ways to mitigate demographic change .
I am therefore convinced that an open and honest debate is essential in order to discuss the various immigration policies .
The eradication of prejudice to different cultures is a precondition for the successful integration of immigrants , which also enriches solidarity between generations and cultures .
The report also proposes adopting new provisions against discrimination on grounds of access to goods and services .
I therefore voted in favour of Mr Mann 's report .
For several years , a marked decline in their birth rate , the EU Member States have had to cope with the ageing challenge of the population .
One of the positive aspects of demographic change is that people are becoming more old and even more active , physically and mentally more active .
In this context , it is becoming clear that we will face the prospect of exacerbating a situation that has a demographic imbalance that will have an impact on the Member States ' economies and budgetary resources , which also has an impact on the EU as a whole .
Consequently , the financial burden of these demographic changes is likely to bring about a risk of future generations .
This situation makes the Lisbon objective of achieving a 50 % employment rate for people in the age of 55 to 64 absolutely essential , although it was not achieved this year .
In view of this situation , it is important to rapidly and decisively increase the participation of young and older people in the labour market in a working life-based approach .
The unemployment rate among the 15-24 years is much higher than that of all other age groups in the European Union .
Consequently , the European  ⁇ outh Guarantee proposal should be recommended .
First of all , I would like to congratulate Mr Mann on drafting this report , which has the merit of proposing specific measures to lay the foundations for open and honest dialogue between generations .
I voted in favour of the report because I believe that the establishment of a fair balance between the generations is the only way to give the young generation of real insurance and increase their participation in the labour market .
I also believe that it is time for the European Union and for the Member States to examine the new questions tabled by the generation generation generation .
Indeed , Europe will soon be facing serious problems as a result of its low demographic growth , and adequate policies need to be adopted immediately in order not to jeopardise the whole European social security system .
In this regard , I believe it is essential to re-eval social policy for over 60 years .
People in this class age are bringing added value to the world of work , and preparatory measures should therefore be taken so that they are more involved in it .
I therefore agree with the proposal to revise the social security system in order to allow for more than 60 years to retain their jobs after they have reached the retirement age .
I believe that the rapporteur proposes two good measures to correct the impact of demographic imbalances on funding social expenditure and the financial situation of pension systems in all Member States .
The first measure is to increase the participation of young people in the labour market and the second measure to retirement age .
I agree with the rapporteur 's view that the elderly are not a burden , but that they are instead an asset to the economy and society because of their experience , as they have done and their knowledge .
I decided to vote in favour of the report , because the controversial party supporting the idea of replacing the current pay-as-you-go system with a funded system has been withdrawn from the report .
I voted against the report .
It deals with the demographic problem and solidarity between generations in a very conservative manner .
In many areas , such as almost unlimitedly unlimited life , it casts labour law and social benefits for workers and will completely exhausted them .
The problem of youth unemployment is becoming increasingly worse .
Improving life expectancies and levels become a problem , rather than a pan-European pan-European objective .
Today , we are facing a high level of unemployment for young people and under-financing of pension schemes .
We must find a common solution because young people must be considered as a precious and essential resource for achieving the economic and social objectives , especially in an ageing society .
If we fail to turn the current trend into a reversal , we believe that between now and 2030 , the proportion between active and inactive assets will be of 2 against 1 .
Although the main instruments for promoting fairness between the generations fall within the responsibility of the Member States , the EU plays a key role in monitoring and monitoring the proper and effective application of European legislation on combating discrimination , and in terms of promoting the exchange of best practices and action programmes .
It is essential for the EU and Member States to take new initiatives in favour of active ageing , healthy and dignity .
It is also necessary to open young people with long-term prospects and to take measures to promote mobility during their studies , to guarantee high-quality vocational training and create new jobs , thus ensuring full participation in society .

Déclarations écrites ( article 149 )
Due to the overestimation of the risk of credit , rating agencies have been one of the factors which triggered the global financial crisis .
Furthermore , there is no true competition in the credit rating agencies sector .
This situation increases the risk of conflicts of interest and , by extension , a lack of transparency and quality at the level of allocating notes to the various financial instruments .
The regulation that gives rise to the creation of the European Securities and Markets Authority ( CMO ) will come into effect on 1 January 2011 .
Its main prerogative will be to supervise the agencies of this kind .
The introduction of a mechanism for monitoring and supervising credit rating agencies at EU level proves to be indispensable .
I believe that this new authority must exercise its mandate once it has been set up .
I would like to emphasise that the decision by the United States on the implementation of stricter control rules has paved the way for global harmonisation .
The European Union has already laid down rules which will come into effect at the end of the year .
The rules for rating agencies that want to operate in the European Union , and therefore obtain a licence , include , among other things , the obligation to register and comply with the rules on transparency and ' good conduct ' .
I do not think that these rules are rather strict , and I am delighted with the additional measures that we are discussing in the Committee on Economic and Monetary Affairs .
These agencies currently have a lot of power and may plung a state and even a system ( by reducing the note of countries and causing a panic in the world market chain ) in a crisis with a ratings .
Their work is important as regards guaranteeing reliability and stability , but doubts remain over the rules and criteria for their ratings .
Therefore , Mr Gauzès ' report , which proposes introducing credit rating agencies under the supervision of the European Securities and Markets Authority , is a step in the right direction .

L' adoption internationale soulève également une série de questions et de difficultés spécifiques , essentiellement découlant de l' interaction limitée entre les parents d' un enfant et de la promotion promotion préalable à l' adoption , ainsi que des problèmes rencontrés par l' enfant après l' adoption en rapport avec l' ajustement linguistique et culturel .

L' examen-clé lors de l' examen du sujet des adoptions et de l' élaboration de la résolution est le principe de réintégration du système de protection des enfants dans une famille biologique ou étendue .

Il est très difficile de trouver l' équilibre , mais je pense que nous avons besoin - tout en tenant compte de la Convention de La Haye , etc. - où l' on observe les parents les plus good et au-delà de la reproche , de les faciliter en accordant un cadeau de foyer heureux à un enfant qui n' a pas été le seul , et non de les concourir avec des processus interminables , coûteux et coûteux .
Nous devons trouver un juste équilibre parce que , en tant qu' enseignant , j' ai rencontré de nombreux enfants adoptés et la vaste majorité dans des foyers très bons .

On 31 December 2010 saw the end of a relativelyot Presidency , which some have a huge tord and weak one .
We could not expect anything else from a Belgian government which has not actually existed for eight months .
Belgian politicians have not managed to set up a political plan for their own country , which is going through an unprecedented institutional crisis .

The Belgian Presidency was supposed to put Europe on the path to relaunch the economic and financial crisis .
However , this presents us once again to combat speculation which threatens the single currency 's very existence today .
It is the Belgian Presidency which is behind the acceleration of future enlargement of the EU 's borders .
As we have seen in recent years , the accession of economically weak countries has made the work of the European institutions difficult and weakened Europe as a whole , which is no longer even today taking responsibility for the internal problems of new Member States .
The Belgian Presidency of the European Union has occupied over the last six months and there almost no one seems to have noticed it .
The country was mainly concerned - and , without success - with a new government , the conflict between the Flamands and Wallons having made the country incapable of taking political decisions .
It is therefore not surprising that the European political établissement had the task so easy in its desire to make progress with centralisation within the European Union .
The crisis in the euro area has been used as a pretext for developing European economic governance plans .
In the meantime , the ' permanent rescue plan ' for the euro is nothing more than an attack on net contributors , who will have to pay even more in future .
Belgium should , in fact , be seen as a warning of what happens when people who have different economic performance are bound by force among each other .
Belgium , where disputes between Flamands and Wallons are clearly irreconcilable , and where the federal apparatus consists of a mechanism for the redistribution of wealth to Wallons , shows what could happen to the European Union and the euro area if they continue to be on this path .
To sum up the Belgian Presidency , first of all , it is to be welcomed that it is extremely active in designing the European financial stability system .
All those who have observed this process know that this is a perilous exercise , which has taken place under the pressure of the calendar .
That is why I would like to express my sincere congratulations to everyone who has contributed to the fulfilment of this project .
In this regard , the Belgian Presidency has done a very good job in the Hungarian Presidency .
It should also be highlighted that the Belges have overcome the path to future Presidencies when it comes to the entry into force of the Treaty of Lisbon .
I would like to express the hope that future Presidencies , including Polish Presidencies , will set out clear priorities , but which nevertheless respond to common European objectives .
This way of work allows it to plan and carry out the policies of the European institutions to a greater extent .
I would like to begin by congratulating the Belgian Presidency , which has shown exceptional qualities in the head of the European Council over the last six months .
The Belgian team may be regarded as even more performant as it has reeded the Presidency 's dreamd in difficult circumstances .

Without the internal problems faced by the Belgian Presidency .

It allowed its internal problems and issues on the one hand in order to adopt a line corresponding to the proposals of the European Parliament , the European Commission and the Council , and to support these institutions .
The Presidency took on a role as mediator .
With regard to the priority objectives achieved by the Presidency , the measures to combat the economic crisis should be welcomed , and I am thinking especially about the work on the next Multiannual Financial Framework .
The Eurovignette is yet another important success of the Belgian Presidency .
Finally , I would like to say that the Belgian Presidency may serve as an example to the forthcoming countries that will occupy the Presidency of the European Council .
I would like to wish the very success of the Hungarian Presidency and of the Polish Presidency , which will begin in the second half of 2011 .
I would like to express my thanks to the Belgian Presidency .
Its work , which has only just finished , can serve as a model for the countries that will direct the work of the European Council in the future .
This is a particularly close issue to my heart in view of the forthcoming Presidency of Poland , which I hope will follow the path that the Belgian Presidency is so successful .
It is not known that the Presidency is going to adopt the Community measures before its national interests .
As far as I am concerned , the main success of this Presidency was the consistent implementation of the provisions of the Treaty of Lisbon , especially at European Council level , which has become a full institution with a permanent President , and at the level of the Foreign Affairs Council , which is currently governed by the High Representative .
The fight against the economic crisis is also of major importance and monitoring and systematic restraint in the financial sector will allow it to repress its reputation as a result of time .
This is particularly important at a time when the pressure for the enlargement of the euro area is extremely high .
To sum up , I sincerely hope that the path being marked under the Belgian Presidency will be a reference for the countries which will take on board future Presidencies .
I will always give our priority to the Community .

The European Union and its institutions have a duty and responsibility to ensure respect for human rights , including those of all minorities .
Therefore , they must reject and combat any form of discrimination , particularly as regards sexual orientation .
In this context , I support Parliament 's resolution and consider it to be an initiative to reaffirm the values and principles on which the European Union 's identity is founded , without jeopardising the fundamental principle of subsidiarity .
I would stress the recognition and respect of the right of a Member State , such as Lithuania , to freely debate and comparison of various concepts and ideas during the amendment process and adopting its national legislation .
I would also stress that the Lithuanian authorities have restated their determination to respect the European legal framework and not to go against it , as well as to promote respect for human rights .
Lithuania is seeking to prevent prostitution in favour of certain minority sexual guidelines , preferably , and rightly so , because we want to promote the family made up of a father , mother and their children , as a child , as a whole , as the basis of society .
This constitutes an intolerable attack on human rights and discrimination .
However , as shown by the resolution tabled by the Group of the European People 's Party ( Christian Democrats ) and European Democrats , the legislative process in this country , which is far from being completed , is being examined by the competent supervisory authorities in relation to the constitutional and international commitments of Lithuania .
This text also clearly reminds us , and I quote , ' the right of any democracy to change and adopt national laws and provisions without interfering in the debates of national parliaments ' .
⁇ et the very fact that we are debating here and submitting texts is interference and a violation of the rights of Lithuania and Lithuanian citizens .
That is intolerable .
